title: Sample and Data Relationship Format for Proteomics (SDRF-Proteomics)
content:
// suppress inspection "GrazieInspection" for whole file
Sample and Data Relationship Format for Proteomics (SDRF-Proteomics)

//only works on some backends, not HTML

//use style like Section 1 when referencing within the document.

//GitHub specific settings

Status of this document

This document provides information to the proteomics community about a proposed standard for sample metadata annotations in public repositories called Sample and Data Relationship Format (SDRF)-Proteomics. Distribution is unlimited.

Version v1.1.0 - 2025-01

Abstract

The Human Proteome Organisation (HUPO) Proteomics Standards Initiative (PSI) defines community standards for data representation in proteomics to facilitate data comparison, exchange, and verification. This document presents a specification for the Sample and Data Relationship Format (SDRF-Proteomics).

Further detailed information, including any updates to this document, implementations, and examples is available at SDRF GitHub Repository. The official PSI web page for the document is: HUPO-PSI SDRF.

Motivation

Many resources have emerged that provide raw or integrated proteomics data in the public domain. If these are valuable individually, their integration through re-analysis represents a huge asset for the community .

Unfortunately, proteomics experimental design and sample related information are often missing in public repositories or stored in very diverse ways and formats. For example:

- The CPTAC Consortium provides for every dataset a set of Excel files with the information on each sample including tumor size, origin, but also how every sample is related to a specific raw file (e.g. instrument configuration parameters).

- As a resource routinely re-analysing public datasets, ProteomicsDB captures for each sample in the database a minimum number of properties to describe the sample and the related experimental protocol such as tissue, digestion method and instrument.

Such heterogeneity often prevents dat
keywords: AC MC MINOR INFRINGE data file characteristics SWATH MHC SN sample PEPTIDESEQ SDRF proteomics data acquisition method PATCH source name SILAC TIP MS:1001251 CPTAC REQUIRED RFC INFORMATION FAIR fraction identifier FITNESS organism part not LC ALL JA spiked compound ROW RIGHTS ENVO ZFA SHALL README PRIDE:0000590 PARTICULAR CV MOD PRIDE:0000833 DJ instrument CELL disease OR LI OPTIONAL COLUMN MAJOR sex LIMITED URI NCBI MS EW ISA cell type technical replicate PRM EXPRESS CL II HUPO PRIDE:0000832 PSI exclamation PRIDE:0000659 AS HEREIN WILL BTO PURPOSE VK developmental stage BUT MERCHANTABILITY cleavage agent details VCF PATO IMPORTANT MIAPE ancestry category SRM OF NT UBERON biosample accession number QY MAY INITIATIVE PRIDE STANDARDS PRIDE:0000831 CS RECOMMEND DIA TO FOR TAB NOTE BRENDA label HCD FDR IDF PROTEOMICS PRIDE:0000834 EM DOID mass MONDO PTM SP MIAME WARRANTY TA RAW URL INCLUDING ANY AND RECOMMENDED PMID XML disease stage TMT CN BE NCIT EFO SAMEA IS CF WARRANTIES EBI organism PP IMPLIED age file your individual DDA THAT PS pooled sample HLA MUST HTML DISCLAIMS SHOULD MT PATO:0000461 ID HF CLO HANCESTRO NCIT:C25683 III NOT SAMN USE PO MAGE COULD NCIT:C25714 YAML THE BMC ... REQUIRES biological replicate NCI MS:1000484 CT PMCID

title: Sample Metadata Guidelines
content:
Sample Metadata Guidelines

Introduction

This document provides guidelines for annotating general sample metadata in SDRF-Proteomics format. These guidelines apply to samples from any organism (human, animal, plant).

For human-specific metadata (disease staging, comorbidities, treatment history), see Human Sample Metadata Guidelines.

Version 1.0.0 - 2025-01

Organism

Column: characteristics[organism]

Ontology: NCBI Taxonomy (NCBITaxon)

Use the scientific name in lowercase. The validator will map to the correct ontology term.

Value |NCBITaxon ID |Description

homo sapiens |NCBITaxon:9606 |Human
mus musculus |NCBITaxon:10090 |Mouse
rattus norvegicus |NCBITaxon:10116 |Rat
danio rerio |NCBITaxon:7955 |Zebrafish
drosophila melanogaster |NCBITaxon:7227 |Fruit fly
arabidopsis thaliana |NCBITaxon:3702 |Thale cress

Organism Part / Tissue

Column: characteristics[organism part]

Ontology: UBERON for mammals/vertebrates, Plant Ontology (PO) for plants, FlyBase Anatomy (FBbt) for Drosophila.

Use lowercase for all values. For cell line samples, use not applicable or specify the tissue of origin (e.g., cervix for HeLa).

Value |UBERON ID |Description

blood |UBERON:0000178 |Whole blood
blood plasma |UBERON:0001969 |Blood plasma
liver |UBERON:0002107 |Liver tissue
brain |UBERON:0000955 |Brain
heart |UBERON:0000948 |Heart
kidney |UBERON:0002113 |Kidney

Age

Column: characteristics[age]

Format: {Number}{Unit} where Unit is: Y (Years), M (Months), W (Weeks), D (Days).

For age ranges use: {LowerBound}{Unit}-{UpperBound}{Unit} (e.g., 40Y-50Y).

Use not available when age is unknown, not applicable for immortalized cell lines.

Age Description |SDRF Value

40 years old |40Y
8 weeks old |8W

Developmental Stage

Column: characteristics[developmental stage]

Ontology: UBERON, EFO

Value |Description

adult |Sexually mature organism
embryonic |Pre-birth/pre-hatching

For model organisms, use specific stages when applicable: embryonic day 14 (mouse E14), 24 hpf (zebrafish 24 hou
keywords: EFO UBERON:0002113 organism NOTE age APP exclamation UBERON:0000955 SDRF MONDO:0004989 depletion CL:0000084 PDX MONDO:0005148 MUST developmental stage enrichment process organism part MONDO:0004975 UBERON:0002107 DOID MONDO PTM CL:0000815 UBERON:0000948 PATO:0000461 ID PATO COVID UBERON:0000178 MONDO:0100096 disease CL:0000624 UBERON UBERON:0001969 CL:0000057 MAY PO xenograft CL:0000236 PATO:0001421 NCBI cell type CL:0000066 CL:0000235 synthetic peptide CL

title: Sample Metadata Guidelines
content:
Sample Metadata Guidelines

Introduction

This document provides guidelines for annotating general sample metadata in SDRF-Proteomics format. These guidelines apply to samples from any organism (human, animal, plant).

For human-specific metadata (disease staging, comorbidities, treatment history), see Human Sample Metadata Guidelines.

Version 1.0.0 - 2025-01

Organism

Column: characteristics[organism]

Ontology: NCBI Taxonomy (NCBITaxon)

Use the scientific name in lowercase. The validator will map to the correct ontology term.

Value |NCBITaxon ID |Description

homo sapiens |NCBITaxon:9606 |Human
mus musculus |NCBITaxon:10090 |Mouse
rattus norvegicus |NCBITaxon:10116 |Rat
danio rerio |NCBITaxon:7955 |Zebrafish
drosophila melanogaster |NCBITaxon:7227 |Fruit fly
arabidopsis thaliana |NCBITaxon:3702 |Thale cress

Organism Part / Tissue

Column: characteristics[organism part]

Ontology: UBERON for mammals/vertebrates, Plant Ontology (PO) for plants, FlyBase Anatomy (FBbt) for Drosophila.

Use lowercase for all values. For cell line samples, use not applicable or specify the tissue of origin (e.g., cervix for HeLa).

Value |UBERON ID |Description

blood |UBERON:0000178 |Whole blood
blood plasma |UBERON:0001969 |Blood plasma
liver |UBERON:0002107 |Liver tissue
brain |UBERON:0000955 |Brain
heart |UBERON:0000948 |Heart
kidney |UBERON:0002113 |Kidney

Age

Column: characteristics[age]

Format: {Number}{Unit} where Unit is: Y (Years), M (Months), W (Weeks), D (Days).

For age ranges use: {LowerBound}{Unit}-{UpperBound}{Unit} (e.g., 40Y-50Y).

Use not available when age is unknown, not applicable for immortalized cell lines.

Age Description |SDRF Value

40 years old |40Y
8 weeks old |8W

Developmental Stage

Column: characteristics[developmental stage]

Ontology: UBERON, EFO

Value |Description

adult |Sexually mature organism
embryonic |Pre-birth/pre-hatching

For model organisms, use specific stages when applicable: embryonic day 14 (mouse E14), 24 hpf (zebrafish 24 hou
keywords: EFO UBERON:0002113 organism age APP UBERON:0000955 SDRF MONDO:0004989 depletion CL:0000084 PDX MONDO:0005148 MUST developmental stage enrichment process organism part MONDO:0004975 UBERON:0002107 DOID MONDO PTM CL:0000815 UBERON:0000948 PATO:0000461 ID PATO COVID UBERON:0000178 MONDO:0100096 disease CL:0000624 UBERON UBERON:0001969 CL:0000057 MAY PO xenograft CL:0000236 PATO:0001421 NCBI cell type CL:0000066 CL:0000235 synthetic peptide CL

title: Human Sample Metadata Guidelines
content:
Human Sample Metadata Guidelines

Introduction

This document provides guidelines for annotating human-specific metadata in SDRF-Proteomics format. These guidelines apply to clinical studies and healthy human samples.

For general sample metadata (organism, age, sex, basic disease), see Sample Metadata Guidelines.

Version 1.0.0 - 2025-01

Disease Stage

Column: characteristics[disease stage]

Ontology: NCI Thesaurus (NCIT)

Value |NCIT ID |Description

stage I |NCIT:C27966 |Early localized disease
stage IV |NCIT:C27971 |Distant metastasis

Use not available when stage is unknown, not applicable for non-cancer samples.

TNM Staging

Column: characteristics[TNM staging]

Ontology: NCI Thesaurus (NCIT)

Format: T{0-4}N{0-3}M{0-1} where T = tumor size/extent, N = lymph node involvement, M = distant metastasis. Prefix p indicates pathological staging.

Value |Description

T1N0M0 |Small tumor, no nodes, no metastasis
pT2pN1M0 |Pathological staging after surgery

Tumor Grade

Column: characteristics[tumor grade]

Ontology: NCI Thesaurus (NCIT)

Value |NCIT ID |Description

grade 1 |NCIT:C28076 |Well differentiated
grade 3 |NCIT:C28078 |Poorly differentiated

Cancer-Specific Classifications

Breast cancer subtype (characteristics[breast cancer subtype]):

Value |NCIT ID |Description

luminal A |NCIT:C53554 |ER+/PR+, HER2-, low Ki67
triple-negative |NCIT:C71732 |ER-/PR-/HER2-

Other classifications: characteristics[Dukes stage] for colorectal cancer, characteristics[Ann Arbor stage] for lymphoma.

Pre-existing Condition

Column: characteristics[pre-existing condition]

Ontology: MONDO Disease Ontology

For multiple conditions, use multiple columns (preferred) or semicolon-separated values.

Condition |SDRF Value |MONDO ID

High blood pressure |hypertension |MONDO:0005044
Diabetes |type 2 diabetes mellitus |MONDO:0005148

Treatment

Column: characteristics[treatment]

Ontology: NCI Thesaurus (NCIT)

Value |NCIT ID |Description

chemotherapy |NCIT:C15632 |Chemical drug treatm
keywords: PR treatment status ER individual exclamation MONDO:0005044 CHEBI:27899 SDRF NCIT:C27971 NCIT:C4870 NCIT:C53554 MONDO:0005148 treatment response treatment organism part menopausal status GDPR HANCESTRO:0009 AJCC Dukes stage Ann Arbor stage compound dose NCIT:C27966 CHEBI:28748 MONDO NCIT:C15632 TNM TNM staging HANCESTRO:0005 ID NCIT:C18206 NCIT:C65107 tumor grade NCIT:C28076 IV IMPORTANT pre-existing condition HANCESTRO ancestry category body mass index NCIT:C65108 HIPAA NCIT:C65106 breast cancer subtype NCIT:C15262 NCIT weight NCI disease stage sampling time point smoking status NCIT:C28078 NCIT:C71732

chemotherapy |NCIT:C15632 |Chemical drug treatm

title: Data File Metadata Guidelines
content:
Data File Metadata Guidelines

Introduction

This document provides detailed guidelines for data file metadata fields that require specific formatting or have complex standardization requirements. For basic field descriptions, see the main SDRF-Proteomics specification.

Version 1.0.0 - 2025-01

CV Term Format

For data file metadata columns that reference ontology terms, use the structured CV term format:

NT={term name};AC={accession}

Examples:

- Dissociation method: NT=HCD;AC=PRIDE:0000590
- Fractionation method: NT=High-pH reversed-phase chromatography;AC=PRIDE:0000564
- Instrument: NT=Q Exactive HF;AC=MS:1002523
- Label: NT=TMT126;AC=PRIDE:0000285

Why use the structured format?

1. Automated annotation: Many data file properties (instrument, acquisition method, dissociation method) can be automatically determined by software from raw files.
2. Validation: Accession numbers enable automated validation against ontologies.
3. Interoperability: Structured terms are unambiguous across different tools and databases.

 Unlike sample metadata (characteristics) which are typically annotated manually using simple term names, data file metadata benefits from the structured CV term format because these values are often extracted programmatically from instrument files.

Label

Column: comment[label]

Ontology: PRIDE Ontology - Label

Describes the isotopic label applied to each sample.

Label-free: Use label free sample.

TMT labels: TMT126, TMT127N, TMT127C, TMT128N, TMT128C, TMT129N, TMT129C, TMT130N, TMT130C, TMT131N, TMT131C, TMT132N, TMT132C, TMT133N, TMT133C, TMT134N, TMT134C, TMT135N

iTRAQ labels: iTRAQ113, iTRAQ114, iTRAQ115, iTRAQ116, iTRAQ117, iTRAQ118, iTRAQ119, iTRAQ121

SILAC labels: SILAC light, SILAC medium, SILAC heavy

MS2 Mass Analyzer

Column: comment[MS2 mass analyzer]

Ontology: PSI-MS - Mass analyzer type (MS:1000443)

Specifies the analyzer used for MS2 scans. Important for hybrid instruments.

Common values:

Analyzer |Accession

orbitrap |MS:100
keywords: AC MS:1001917 TCEP NCE SDRF DTT SILAC TIP depletion MS:1001251 ETD PRIDE:0000285 REQUIRED fragment mass tolerance fraction identifier SDS SH PRIDE:0000564 README UNIMOD:1 PRIDE:0000590 CV MOD MS:1000422 MS CAA PSI exclamation scan window upper limit CID precursor mass tolerance PRIDE:0000551 cleavage agent details UNIMOD dissociation method modification parameters PRIDE:0000565 MS:1000081 MS1 scan range UNIMOD:4 alkylation reagent MS:1000264 NT MS:1001309 OLS PRIDE DIA IAM NOTE TOF label HCD IAA PRIDE:0000561 PAGE MS:1001306 MS:1002631 PRIDE:0000553 collision energy UNIMOD:21 MS:1002523 scan window lower limit TA MS:1001303 UVPD MS:1000443 MS:1000598 reduction reagent RECOMMENDED MS:1001045 SCX TMT PP MS:1000084 MT MS:1001313 UNIMOD:35 HF MS2 mass analyzer MS:1003246 MS:1000133 fractionation method MS:1000484
